Skill: Dragon Guards of the Heavens gain "Essence of Martial Arts"
Skill: Peasant Units gain "Essence of Martial Arts"
Skill: Dragon Guards of the Heavens gain "Protector"
Skill: Assimilated Beastmen Units gain "Primal Instinct"
White Lancers of the Northern Frontier

Terracotta warriors forged by Cathayan artisans. They are slow-moving but boast higher [[img:ui/skins/default/icon_stat_armour.png]][[/img]] armor and durability than standard units, with strong resistance to magic and fire. They are unaffected by [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]] morale and [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/fatigue_immune.png]][[/img]] fatigue. Master artisans of Cathay can repair and enhance them during battle.
White blades strike as swift as lightning, commanding the battlefield.
Cathayan warriors wear helms bearing the visage of the Celestial King, which [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/causes_fear.png]][[/img]] instills fear in their enemies.
The Crimson Watch are elite investigators planted in every province by the Imperial Council. Their watchful eyes miss no detail, and all intelligence is relayed to the council.
Steel titans defend the borderlands, forged to safeguard Cathay against all threats.
The Dragon Emperor’s Guard are the ultimate defenders of the imperial palace, chosen by the divine. Their strength surpasses that of other Cathayan armies.
These warriors don battle attire symbolizing celestial grace, commanding respect and inspiring allies.
With divine might, they dominate the battlefield and uphold the glory of the Dragon Emperor.
Blades crafted to pierce the arcane, sharp and deadly.
Court Guardians, skilled in medicine and alchemy, bestow blessings and healing upon allies. They restore health to nearby units.
Graceful archers clad in azure, masters of long-range precision.
This unit hails from Cathay’s northern nomadic tribes, with morale effects that only influence other nomadic units.

This elite unit represents one of Cathay’s Imperial Armies, boasting high [[img:icon_melee_attack]][[/img]] melee attack and [[img:icon_melee_defence]][[/img]] melee defense, often augmented with unique attack effects.
Bestowed blessings of the Moon Court grant this unit healing abilities for themselves and nearby allies.

This mythical beast from Cathay’s legends possesses high [[img:icon_melee_attack]][[/img]] melee attack and [[img:icon_melee_defence]][[/img]] melee defense, terrifies enemies with [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/causes_terror.png]][[/img]] and wields powerful special abilities.
This unit’s ranged attacks pierce multiple units in a line, causing devastating damage.
The unmatched skills of Imperial experts.
Decades of service under the Vermillion Bird’s light.
The Emerald Sentinels stand as unyielding protectors of Cathay.
Tidal warriors, their formations adapt to any battlefield challenge.
The eternal cycle of harmony and creation.
Units disregard death for a limited time.
The Tideguard shifts formations to adapt to battlefield scenarios.
Thunder Strike: A decisive spell usable once per battle, inflicting significant morale penalties in an area.
Earthfire Storm: A decisive spell usable once per battle, dealing devastating damage within a fixed area.
As the Duke of Yan united the Nomads under the Empire, the Qisha and Dragon Guards stand together against Chaos.
Fallen warriors are reborn under the Vermillion Bird’s light.
These reclusive beastmen warriors have honed their blade skills to perfection, sweeping through enemy lines like an autumn wind.
The White Tiger’s ferocity intimidates enemies and emboldens allies.
Guardians of Cathay’s ancient bastions, these warriors keep all manner of evil at bay.
The martial spirit resonates through the temple’s bells, for all martial arts stem from Shaolin.
To achieve the foundation of wisdom, one must cleanse the six roots and empty the five aggregates.
The ancient temple’s bells echo, warding off evil and upholding peace.
The Tideguard, chosen by the Leviathan Dragon over years of coastal warfare, have forged unique tactics to repel relentless invasions.
To commoners, the Imperial Guards are akin to divine beings.
Righteous anger erupts beneath stormy skies.\\n\\nWith unyielding resolve, we roar toward the heavens.
Members of the Crimson Watch use specialized weapons to ensnare and strike distant targets with precision.
Nangao, the heart of Cathayan forging, produces unparalleled weapons, including those wielded by the Ironwall Sentinels.
The Suanni, a guardian beast, stands against all forms of treachery and evil.
Resembling a bird, this creature wields thunder and lightning, inspiring dread wherever it appears.
The Forest Walker’s intoxicating aura alone can inebriate nearby foes.
The statues guarding the temple embody vast reserves of spiritual energy within their jade-forged forms.
The gilded armor of the Dragon Emperor’s Guard reflects Cathay’s superior craftsmanship and the Emperor’s strength.
Women play a vital role in Cathayan forces, but only a select few, chosen by the Moon Queen, receive her blessings and serve in her name.
The White Lancers don hides of northern beasts blessed by the Moon Queen, granting them remarkable resilience.
The Southern Phoenix Guards are devout followers of the Vermillion Bird, embodying its fiery fervor and lighting up the southern lands.
Jade Shields harbor the essence of celestial winds, their proud roars striking terror into invaders.
You entrusted me with the phoenix wood; I repay you with valor.\\n\\nIn death, I fulfill my loyalty.
Heavenly King’s wrath extinguishes all malevolence.
The Heavenly King embodies compassion, bridging the realms of north and south.
The Ravenwing Corps’ armor is imbued with anti-demonic feathers, aiding them in purging heretical threats.
The Black Tortoise embodies eternal life, preserving its vitality through millennia.
A single sword defended three thousand miles; one warrior turned back a million troops.
The Moon Queen’s powers include healing, and her followers strive to embody her compassion.
Though their second life fades, these spirits fight relentlessly for their homeland.
The Moonlit Archers, attendants of the Moon Queen, can extinguish the sun with their blessed arrows.
The Emerald Court’s unity and coordination surpass all other Imperial forces.
The Vermillion Bird draws celestial energy, leading the armies to glory.
Thunder strikes forged into bolts of immense power, echoing across the land.
Breathing fire and flame, the tempest scorches all deceit.
The Vermillion Bird’s cry commands all avian life to bow.
Cathay’s terracotta warriors embody the will of its past heroes, serving as eternal guardians of the realm.
The Imperial Guards are comprised of elite warriors from Cathay’s various courts, tasked with safeguarding the empire.
Rest easy upon the battlefield; few return from the sands of war.
Tidal warriors embody resilience, safeguarding Cathay’s shores.
For seventy years, the Phoenix Guards have lit the southern frontier.
White blades strike swift as lightning, commanding the battlefield.
Mortal shells fade; eternal guardians endure.
These southern beastmen are said to be descended from the Dragon Emperor, serving as his talons against imperial foes.
Tiger Guards excel in breaking enemy lines with their fierce combat skills.
Dancing with blades, they illuminate the battlefield.
The Crimson Watch shatters deceit and punishes betrayal.
Steel defends the frontier, safeguarding Cathay.
Clad in celestial armor, these women embody martial grace.
Nomadic warriors are fierce mercenaries, loyal to Cathay’s borderlands.
Bronze cannons of ancient make return to the battlefield.
Blades of anti-magic, swift and lethal.
Armored cavalry charge to secure victory.
Iron rain shields the skies as thunder roars.
Iron rain shields the skies as thunder roars.
Feathers fall like blossoms, blood dyes the earth.
One blade turned back a million.
Armored riders charge with unstoppable force.
[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nThe Black Tortoise stands as the northern sentinel, eternal and steadfast.
Arrows drawn under the moon, aimed to strike meteors.
[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nThe White Tiger, born of metal’s essence, secures the west.
Valor echoes in the mountain passes.
Regional elites of Cathay, balancing loyalty and power.
Defenders of the empire with unmatched devotion.
The Suanni roars, its guardians sing of its valor.
Warriors of unparalleled grace and precision.
Fury burns bright, dedicated to the Emperor.
Cathay’s monks master harmony, aiding both people and empire.
War chariots carve paths to victory.
Heroes of Cathay, swept by the winds of valor.
[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nAllied tribes defend Cathay’s harmony.
Warriors bound by duty and valor.
[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nThe Vermillion Bird rises, leading Cathay’s armies.
The Crimson Watch serve as the Emperor’s eyes and ears, missing no detail.
The cosmic balance sustains all, ever-turning.
Provides nearby units with [[img:icon_yang]][[/img]] Yang Harmony.
Cathayan cavalry charges forward; the battle begins.
Elite riders of the Bastion, serving only the Warden.
The Suanni channels celestial energies to bolster defenses.
The Mountain Colossus is as ancient as Cathay itself, a steadfast ally of the Dragon Emperor.
With immense strength, it crushes all in its path.
Bronze cannons unleash devastating direct shots.
The ingenious design of the Bronze Cannon allows for multiple projectiles to be loaded and fired in an arcing manner, delivering widespread damage.

As masters of Cathay’s Life Wind essence, Jade-Blood Taoists primarily reside in the spiritual sanctuaries of Wengchang, refining their arts. As the Jade-Blood creatures grow rampant, these Taoists are often called upon to banish such calamities. However, some believe that the Taoists themselves are the source of these disasters.
Jade-Blood Taoists manipulate arcane rituals to animate foreign corpses.

[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nXingtian clashed with the Dragon Emperor, who severed his head and buried him in Kunlan. Over eons, shielded by dragon magic, he absorbed the celestial winds, resurrecting with eyes on his chest and a mouth on his navel, wielding axe and shield in an eternal dance.
Xingtian wields axe and shield, driven by unyielding determination.

Zhao Ming’s fascination with mortal innovations is well-known. Despite his belief in superior techniques, his failed imitation of Imperial steam tanks sparked interest in Western technology, leading to this experimental force clad in Imperial-style armor.
Steeped in the harmony of jade and stone, Jade Guardians are steadfast protectors of the Jade Court. Enchanted jade armor grants formidable resistance to even the most devastating magic.
To Cathayans, the lands beyond the Great Bastion symbolize chaos and death. For the Storm Border Army, however, endless wars have forged a way of life amidst these perils.
While in formation, the unit can only advance slowly.
Attacking enemies disrupts formation, but you can move toward targets while maintaining formation.
This unit thrives in blood-soaked combat, growing stronger when outnumbered.
Capable of eliminating single units at incredible speed but vulnerable if swarmed.
The armor of Jade Guardians, crafted from enchanted jade, absorbs the power of celestial winds, periodically deflecting blade attacks.
Constructs powered by celestial winds will eventually falter without intervention, reverting to inert statues.

[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nHouxi, one of Cathay’s ancient beasts, once clashed with the Dragon Emperor. Following her defeat, she swore a blood oath to protect Cathay, securing the Emperor’s forgiveness.
Houxi, who once opposed the Dragon Emperor, unleashed the waters of the Jade River, reshaping the land and taming its chaos.
The abundance of celestial winds has transformed creatures like Houxi into formidable beings. She summons endless serpent swarms to protect allies and ravage foes.
The Vermillion Bird, closely tied to humanity, has protected Cathay for generations, using her human form to wield celestial winds more skillfully.
In her true form, the Vermillion Bird gains exceptional combat agility and battlefield presence.
In human form, the Vermillion Bird can cast bound fire spells.
In true form, the Vermillion Bird excels in mobility and combat prowess.
Clad in resplendent armor, this retinue inspires allies, signaling the presence of Cathay’s most esteemed figures on the battlefield.
With imperial wrath, the armies surge to glory.
The Spirit-Bound Qilin retains a longing for its ancestral lands, even in battle. Rituals of the Sacred Sun are said to attune them to their rider’s will.
Through arcane rites, the souls of the departed are guided back to the Long River.
Fury surges from the depths of the Long River.
Hailing from southeastern Shengjiang, the Jungle Sentinels are masters of forest warfare, deadlier than the tigers they rival.
The tiger’s roar intimidates all, yet these warriors exceed even that fearsome majesty.
Recruited Unit Level: Assimilated Beastmen Units %+n
Unlock Attribute: Mastery of Celestial Winds
Unlock Attribute: Mastery of Celestial Winds
This unit excels at devastating enemies already engaged in melee but struggles to hit mobile targets.
This unit thrives in forested terrain, gaining additional bonuses when fighting in such environments.
Sun and moon hang high, their light exposing all evil.
Units regenerate ammunition when positioned in forests.
These ogres from the Tusk Path are highly valued by Zhao Ming. In times of peace, they represent Cathay’s courts in tournaments, overwhelming opponents with unmatched strength.
Unlock Attribute: Grants Stealth to Onyx Harpies
Unlock Attribute: Grants Terror to Onyx Harpies
Recruited Unit Level: Onyx Harpy Units %+n
Cathayan Taoists seal the power of celestial winds into talismans for future use.
Cathayan Taoists seal the power of celestial winds into talismans for future use.
Cathayan Taoists seal the power of celestial winds into talismans for future use.
Cathayan Taoists seal the power of celestial winds into talismans for future use.
Cathayan Taoists seal the power of celestial winds into talismans for future use.
The Celestial Masters sacrifice their life force to temporarily summon a fragment of the Soul Dragon's essence to the battlefield.
A fragment of the Soul Dragon's essence is temporarily summoned to the battlefield.
The Soul Dragon is the daughter of the Celestial Dragon Emperor, eternally slumbering beneath the waters, where the departed are drawn to their final rest through her dreams.
Grieving the sacrifices of warriors, the Soul Dragon's wail shakes heaven and earth, while even the winds hesitate to carry away her kin.

Legends tell of the Dragon Emperor personally bestowing his guards with unparalleled power centuries ago. As the Emperor departed, no new blood could replenish their ranks. These final guards remain as his last legacy, and their fall would reduce their name to mere myth.
Only a rare few units possess eternal legendary abilities.
Effect intensity increases with the deaths of nearby allied units.
The Moon Court's arrows are woven from the shadows cast by the Moon Empress. As long as the Veilwind blows, their arrows are infinite.
The ritual grants the target unit different effects but immobilizes the caster and drains their stamina.
Unlock Attribute: Grants Charge Resistance to Zigu Archers
Devastating Surge: A once-per-battle ultimate spell that removes enemy unit protections and deals direct damage.
The White Elephant King's trunk is as flexible and unstoppable as a dragon. If it targets you, close your eyes and pray.
Charged with unmatched strength, the White Elephant King's trunk crushes enemies to death.
The White Elephant King's agile trunk can deflect enemy ranged attacks.
The ability exerts powerful crowd control effects on enemy units.
Striking like a hammer, thunder echoes for miles, shaking heaven and earth.
The ground trembles beneath the White Elephant King’s steps, rendering smaller beings unable to stand, let alone fight.
[[col:green]]"Roar!"[[/col]]\\nA Cathayan linguist concluded after years of study that this cry means "More wine, please!"
The Marshal of the Canopy draws his strength from the Five-Element Compass of Weijing, granting him boundless vitality.
Before joining Cathay, the Marshal was a trusted lieutenant of the Monkey King. Although he cannot shapeshift like the King, he skillfully uses his magic to escape or attack.
Before joining Cathay, the Marshal was a trusted lieutenant of the Monkey King. Although he cannot shapeshift like the King, he skillfully uses his magic to escape or attack.
With the strike of the Celestial Bell, holy beings descend; the Marshal smites demons with divine light, upholding righteousness.
The unit transforms into an unnoticed insect to escape or launch a surprise attack.
The ability deals damage three times consecutively.
The Mountain Colossus is revered as a divine giant by Cathayan people, with a presence as towering as the rivers it spans.
The unit accumulates damage received and unleashes it as a retaliatory blast at the end of a cycle.

[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Complete unit quest[[/col]]\\n\\nBorn from celestial winds and created by the Dragon Emperor, the Overseer enforces his will across heaven and earth. Legends recount how it once executed a rebellious dragon prince, taking his claw as punishment. Mortally wounded, the Overseer was revived with the dragon’s claw replacing its neck, continuing its duty under the Emperor's orders. Now, it is believed to watch over Cathay, ever vigilant for any crisis to rise again.
With wheels of fire beneath its feet, it dances across the battlefield, leaving fiery trails in its wake.
Celestial winds erupt, forming a fiery storm that is nearly impenetrable. Face true power.
A single incantation summons fire to strike down enemies.
With a blade of righteousness, it severs the roots of chaos.
The Sword of Purity releases celestial winds from its gourd to bless allies.
With a pluck of its pipa, celestial energies erupt as weapons to strike enemies.
Under the Storm King’s magical umbrella lies wind and rain, ready to be unleashed with a single motion.
These guardians of Cathay possess high [[img:icon_melee_attack]][[/img]] melee attack and [[img:icon_melee_defence]][[/img]] melee defense, wielding powerful abilities to influence the battlefield.
Eight hundred li of Yellow Wind Ridge once thrived but is now a wasteland plagued by rats, devoid of human life.
A series of small explosives detonate in rapid succession, unleashing devastating flames.
The rats’ shields are imbued with the Yellow Wind Saint’s magic, forming an unyielding barrier that dissipates after one use.
Loyal to the Yellow Wind Saint, these rats detonate their explosives upon death.
The Celestial Arhat embodies the thirty-six external and thirty-six internal arts of Cathay’s temples.
Missile Block Chance: Sky Lantern and Sky Junk Units %+n%
Unlock Attribute: Grants 360° missile defense to Sky Lantern and Sky Junk Units
The Tideguard are the most formidable force along Cathay’s coastline, forged through relentless battles against invasions.
The Tideguard are the most formidable force along Cathay’s coastline, forged through relentless battles against invasions.
These militia, though able to repel external enemies, remain mere commoners. To survive the battlefield, they require more training.
These militia, though able to repel external enemies, remain mere commoners. Better to station them in garrisons to aid in both defense and production.
These militia, though able to repel external enemies, remain mere commoners. To survive the battlefield, they require more training.
These militia, though able to repel external enemies, remain mere commoners. To survive the battlefield, they require more training.
Additional rangefinders and recalibrated barrels ensure precise strikes every time!
Experimental in nature, this new gunpowder is not yet widely used, but the wreckage it leaves speaks for itself.
Pack two more crates of explosives in there!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!
The winds of magic tremble as the fabric of reality is shaken. Demonic armies are invading the mortal world!

[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Defend Cathay’s final line during the tide of destruction[[/col]]\\n\\nThe Celestial Vanguard are the earliest of the Dragon Emperor’s Guard. Even surviving Dragon Sons cannot attest to their origins. These ancient warriors served as personal protectors during Cathay’s unification and wielded a primordial and untamed Celestial Wind. In the Emperor’s absence, the Guard has dwindled after countless wars for Cathay’s survival, their immortal forms gradually deteriorating as they kneel before the long-silent gates of his palace, awaiting his return.
Chaos power is gathering, and the world stands on the brink of annihilation...
Mortals become sacrifices, paving the way for their annihilation.
Unit Capacity: %+n\\nZigu Archers and Guiyin Generals
Unlock Attribute: Grants Immunity to Psychology for Celestial Warriors
Skill: Warriors gain "Song of the Great Wind"
Even in death, leave heroic bones and earn eternal fame.
Unlock Skill: "Song of the Great Wind"
This unit wields Cathayan Horse-Cleavers, enabling them to efficiently repel enemy charges.
Carrying banners adorned with provincial emblems, these vanguard warriors guide the advance of their comrades with their standards.

The workshops of Shang-Yang are filled with Zhao Ming’s gathered artisans: alchemists from the desert, inventors from the Empire, and dreamers with bold designs. Supported by his court, they produce weapons and armor that even Kunlan’s smiths marvel at, crafting an iron army for Cathay.
Forming tight formations, the halberdiers ensure rivers of blood flow beyond their blades.
Where the Xuanpo Legion stands, the Great Bastion stands as well.

[[img:icon_yang]][[col:white]]Unlock: Provide maximum aid to the Border Army at least once[[/col]]\\n\\nThe Border Army forms the backbone of the Great Bastion’s defense, composed of conscripts from various provinces and supplemented by the elite of noble houses seeking redemption. Forged in brutal wars, these soldiers stand as vigilant sentinels, guarding their weary yet magnificent homeland.
Border Army of the Great Bastion
It’s easier to shake mountains than the Border Army.
[[col:yellow]]Equipper has a very low chance of gaining a unique trait[[/col]]
The blade moves like a comet, swift as lightning.

One of Kunlan's Six Swords, the Unity Blade strikes like a comet, swift as lightning, imbued with immense power to redirect the Winds of Magic. Only a talent of exceptional brilliance can unleash its full potential.

Rumengling is the final masterpiece among Kunlan's Six Swords. Though all six are unparalleled divine weapons, the Forging Hall deliberately included flaws in each sword as a safeguard. Rumengling, though less sharp or agile than its counterparts, is inscribed with runes to counter the others. If the swords ever clash, the wielder of Rumengling is destined to restore harmony.
The rains thin, the winds rise; a lingering dream dissolves the remnants of wine.
Where the sword’s light and shadow pass, iron melts into water, and armor crumbles into mud.
Unlock Skill: Grants "Palace Guard" to the Thousand-Year Jinwu Duo
The Jinwu Duo stand as the vanguard of Cathay’s Nine Provinces, composed of peerless warriors.
Unlock Skill: Grants "Exorcism and Demon-Banishing" to Jadeblood Daoists and Longjiang Celestial Masters
Cathay is vast, with spirits and evils lurking in its wilds. Thankfully, Daoists and Celestial Masters roam the land, eradicating demons and protecting the people.
I am the Dragon God’s blade, living to fight and fighting to death.
If the skill is not canceled in time, the Celestial Vanguard will enter a berserk state in Phase Two, leading to rapid collapse.
Drinking the grand winds of heroism; devouring the joyous spirit of nine lands.
